title: How to Fix Nail Pops in Drywall

steps.headline: In the center of the nail pop, place the tip of  nail punch, and tap in with  hammer.
As you tap in the nail pop the sheet rock mud or old Spackle will fall out and break off.
steps.description: If you discover a screw instead of a nail, just tighten the screw by turning clockwise with a Phillips screwdriver. And proceed with step 3.

steps.headline: Using "Dap Fast 'N Final Lightweight Spackling, and a small Spackle blade, spread a small amount over the hole.
Allow to set for about 10 minutes, (Good time to prep other nail pops), then lightly sand the nail pop with fine grit sandpaper (150 - 220).
Brush off excess sanded dust, primer and paint with touch up paint of the same color.

tyn: Dap Fast' N Final Lightweight Spackling
text: In the center of the nail pop, place the tip of  nail punch, and tap in with  hammer.  As you tap in the nail pop the sheet rock mud or old Spackle will fall out and break off. If you discover a screw instead of a nail, just tighten the screw by turning clockwise with a Phillips screwdriver. And proceed with step 3. Using "Dap Fast 'N Final Lightweight Spackling, and a small Spackle blade, spread a small amount over the hole.  Allow to set for about 10 minutes, (Good time to prep other nail pops), then lightly sand the nail pop with fine grit sandpaper (150 - 220).  Brush off excess sanded dust, primer and paint with touch up paint of the same color.
sentences: In the center of the nail pop, place the tip of  nail punch, and tap in with  hammer.
As you tap in the nail pop the sheet rock mud or old Spackle will fall out and break off.
If you discover a screw instead of a nail, just tighten the screw by turning clockwise with a Phillips screwdriver.
Using "Dap Fast 'N Final Lightweight Spackling, and a small Spackle blade, spread a small amount over the hole.
Allow to set for about 10 minutes, (Good time to prep other nail pops), then lightly sand the nail pop with fine grit sandpaper (150 - 220).
Brush off excess sanded dust, primer and paint with touch up paint of the same color.
